CreateBackupPlan.name: CreateBackupPlan
CreateBackupPlan.documentation:
Backup plans are documents that contain information that AWS Backup uses to schedule tasks that create recovery points of resources.

If you call CreateBackupPlan with a plan that already exists, the existing backupPlanId is returned.

CreateBackupSelection.name: CreateBackupSelection
CreateBackupSelection.documentation:
Creates a JSON document that specifies a set of resources to assign to a backup plan. Resources can be included by specifying patterns for a ListOfTags and selected Resources.

For example, consider the following patterns:

  • Resources: "arn:aws:ec2:region:account-id:volume/volume-id"

  • ConditionKey:"department"

    ConditionValue:"finance"

    ConditionType:"StringEquals"

  • ConditionKey:"importance"

    ConditionValue:"critical"

    ConditionType:"StringEquals"

Using these patterns would back up all Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volumes that are tagged as "department=finance", "importance=critical", in addition to an EBS volume with the specified volume Id.

Resources and conditions are additive in that all resources that match the pattern are selected. This shouldn't be confused with a logical AND, where all conditions must match. The matching patterns are logically 'put together using the OR operator. In other words, all patterns that match are selected for backup.

CreateBackupVault.name: CreateBackupVault
CreateBackupVault.documentation:
Creates a logical container where backups are stored. A CreateBackupVault request includes a name, optionally one or more resource tags, an encryption key, and a request ID.

Sensitive data, such as passport numbers, should not be included the name of a backup vault.

DeleteBackupPlan.name: DeleteBackupPlan
DeleteBackupPlan.documentation: Deletes a backup plan. A backup plan can only be deleted after all associated selections of resources have been deleted. Deleting a backup plan deletes the current version of a backup plan. Previous versions, if any, will still exist.

DeleteBackupSelection.name: DeleteBackupSelection
DeleteBackupSelection.documentation: Deletes the resource selection associated with a backup plan that is specified by the SelectionId.

DeleteBackupVault.name: DeleteBackupVault
DeleteBackupVault.documentation: Deletes the backup vault identified by its name. A vault can be deleted only if it is empty.

DeleteBackupVaultAccessPolicy.name: DeleteBackupVaultAccessPolicy
DeleteBackupVaultAccessPolicy.documentation: Deletes the policy document that manages permissions on a backup vault.

DeleteBackupVaultNotifications.name: DeleteBackupVaultNotifications
DeleteBackupVaultNotifications.documentation: Deletes event notifications for the specified backup vault.

DeleteRecoveryPoint.name: DeleteRecoveryPoint
DeleteRecoveryPoint.documentation: Deletes the recovery point specified by a recovery point ID.

DescribeBackupJob.name: DescribeBackupJob
DescribeBackupJob.documentation: Returns metadata associated with creating a backup of a resource.

DescribeBackupVault.name: DescribeBackupVault
DescribeBackupVault.documentation: Returns metadata about a backup vault specified by its name.

DescribeProtectedResource.name: DescribeProtectedResource
DescribeProtectedResource.documentation: Returns information about a saved resource, including the last time it was backed-up, its Amazon Resource Name (ARN), and the AWS service type of the saved resource.

DescribeRecoveryPoint.name: DescribeRecoveryPoint
DescribeRecoveryPoint.documentation: Returns metadata associated with a recovery point, including ID, status, encryption, and lifecycle.

DescribeRestoreJob.name: DescribeRestoreJob
DescribeRestoreJob.documentation: Returns metadata associated with a restore job that is specified by a job ID.

ExportBackupPlanTemplate.name: ExportBackupPlanTemplate
ExportBackupPlanTemplate.documentation: Returns the backup plan that is specified by the plan ID as a backup template.

GetBackupPlan.name: GetBackupPlan
GetBackupPlan.documentation: Returns the body of a backup plan in JSON format, in addition to plan metadata.

GetBackupPlanFromJSON.name: GetBackupPlanFromJSON
GetBackupPlanFromJSON.documentation: Returns a valid JSON document specifying a backup plan or an error.

GetBackupPlanFromTemplate.name: GetBackupPlanFromTemplate
GetBackupPlanFromTemplate.documentation: Returns the template specified by its templateId as a backup plan.

GetBackupSelection.name: GetBackupSelection
GetBackupSelection.documentation: Returns selection metadata and a document in JSON format that specifies a list of resources that are associated with a backup plan.

GetBackupVaultAccessPolicy.name: GetBackupVaultAccessPolicy
GetBackupVaultAccessPolicy.documentation: Returns the access policy document that is associated with the named backup vault.

GetBackupVaultNotifications.name: GetBackupVaultNotifications
GetBackupVaultNotifications.documentation: Returns event notifications for the specified backup vault.

GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata.name: GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata
GetRecoveryPointRestoreMetadata.documentation:
Returns two sets of metadata key-value pairs. The first set lists the metadata that the recovery point was created with. The second set lists the metadata key-value pairs that are required to restore the recovery point.

These sets can be the same, or the restore metadata set can contain different values if the target service to be restored has changed since the recovery point was created and now requires additional or different information in order to be restored.

GetSupportedResourceTypes.name: GetSupportedResourceTypes
GetSupportedResourceTypes.documentation: Returns the AWS resource types supported by AWS Backup.

ListBackupPlanTemplates.name: ListBackupPlanTemplates
ListBackupPlanTemplates.documentation: Returns metadata of your saved backup plan templates, including the template ID, name, and the creation and deletion dates.

ListBackupPlanVersions.name: ListBackupPlanVersions
ListBackupPlanVersions.documentation: Returns version metadata of your backup plans, including Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), backup plan IDs, creation and deletion dates, plan names, and version IDs.

ListBackupPlans.name: ListBackupPlans
ListBackupPlans.documentation: Returns metadata of your saved backup plans, including Amazon Resource Names (ARNs), plan IDs, creation and deletion dates, version IDs, plan names, and creator request IDs.

ListBackupSelections.name: ListBackupSelections
ListBackupSelections.documentation: Returns an array containing metadata of the resources associated with the target backup plan.

ListBackupVaults.name: ListBackupVaults
ListBackupVaults.documentation: Returns a list of recovery point storage containers along with information about them.

ListProtectedResources.name: ListProtectedResources
ListProtectedResources.documentation: Returns an array of resources successfully backed up by AWS Backup, including the time the resource was saved, an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource, and a resource type.

ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault.name: ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault
ListRecoveryPointsByBackupVault.documentation: Returns detailed information about the recovery points stored in a backup vault.

ListRecoveryPointsByResource.name: ListRecoveryPointsByResource
ListRecoveryPointsByResource.documentation: Returns detailed information about recovery points of the type specified by a resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

ListRestoreJobs.name: ListRestoreJobs
ListRestoreJobs.documentation: Returns a list of jobs that AWS Backup initiated to restore a saved resource, including metadata about the recovery process.

ListTags.name: ListTags
ListTags.documentation: Returns a list of key-value pairs assigned to a target recovery point, backup plan, or backup vault.

PutBackupVaultAccessPolicy.name: PutBackupVaultAccessPolicy
PutBackupVaultAccessPolicy.documentation: Sets a resource-based policy that is used to manage access permissions on the target backup vault. Requires a backup vault name and an access policy document in JSON format.

PutBackupVaultNotifications.name: PutBackupVaultNotifications
PutBackupVaultNotifications.documentation: Turns on notifications on a backup vault for the specified topic and events.

StartBackupJob.name: StartBackupJob
StartBackupJob.documentation: Starts a job to create a one-time backup of the specified resource.

StartRestoreJob.name: StartRestoreJob
StartRestoreJob.documentation:
Recovers the saved resource identified by an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

If the resource ARN is included in the request, then the last complete backup of that resource is recovered. If the ARN of a recovery point is supplied, then that recovery point is restored.

StopBackupJob.name: StopBackupJob
StopBackupJob.documentation: Attempts to cancel a job to create a one-time backup of a resource.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Assigns a set of key-value pairs to a recovery point, backup plan, or backup vault identified by an Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes a set of key-value pairs from a recovery point, backup plan, or backup vault identified by an Amazon Resource Name (ARN)

UpdateBackupPlan.name: UpdateBackupPlan
UpdateBackupPlan.documentation: Replaces the body of a saved backup plan identified by its backupPlanId with the input document in JSON format. The new version is uniquely identified by a VersionId.

UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle.name: UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle
UpdateRecoveryPointLifecycle.documentation:
Sets the transition lifecycle of a recovery point.

The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

BackupJobId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a request to AWS Backup to back up a resource.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a backup job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date and time a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

State.documentation: The current state of a resource recovery point.

StatusMessage.documentation: A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a resource.

PercentDone.documentation: Contains an estimated percentage complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.

BackupSizeInBytes.documentation: The size, in bytes, of a backup.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

CreatedBy.documentation: Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan used to create it.

ExpectedCompletionDate.documentation: The date and time a job to back up resources is expected to be completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of ExpectedCompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

StartBy.documentation: Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the StartBy time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of StartBy is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of AWS resource to be backed-up; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

BytesTransferred.documentation: The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the job status was queried.

BackupJob.documentation: Contains detailed information about a backup job.

BackupPlanName.documentation: The display name of a backup plan.

Rules.documentation: An array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.

BackupPlan.documentation: Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a backup rule. Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task and can back up a different selection of AWS resources.

BackupPlanName.documentation: The display name of a backup plan.

Rules.documentation: An array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a scheduled task that is used to back up a selection of resources.

BackupPlanInput.documentation: Contains an optional backup plan display name and an array of BackupRule objects, each of which specifies a backup rule. Each rule in a backup plan is a separate scheduled task and can back up a different selection of AWS resources.

BackupPlanTemplateId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a stored backup plan template.

BackupPlanTemplateName.documentation: The optional display name of a backup plan template.

BackupPlanTemplatesListMember.documentation: An object specifying metadata associated with a backup plan template.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a resource backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

DeletionDate.documentation: The date and time a backup plan is deleted, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of DeletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.

BackupPlanName.documentation: The display name of a saved backup plan.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

LastExecutionDate.documentation: The last time a job to back up resources was executed with this rule. A date and time, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastExecutionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

RuleName.documentation: An optional display name for a backup rule.

TargetBackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

ScheduleExpression.documentation: A CRON expression specifying when AWS Backup initiates a backup job.

StartWindowMinutes.documentation: An optional value that specifies a period of time in minutes after a backup is scheduled before a job is canceled if it doesn't start successfully.

CompletionWindowMinutes.documentation: A value in minutes after a backup job is successfully started before it must be completed or it is canceled by AWS Backup. This value is optional.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

RecoveryPointTags.documentation: An array of key-value pair strings that are assigned to resources that are associated with this rule when restored from backup.

RuleId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a rule that is used to schedule the backup of a selection of resources.

BackupRule.documentation: Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.

RuleName.documentation: >An optional display name for a backup rule.

TargetBackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

ScheduleExpression.documentation: A CRON expression specifying when AWS Backup initiates a backup job.

StartWindowMinutes.documentation: The amount of time in minutes before beginning a backup.

CompletionWindowMinutes.documentation: The amount of time AWS Backup attempts a backup before canceling the job and returning an error.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup will transition and expire backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days”. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

RecoveryPointTags.documentation: To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

BackupRuleInput.documentation: Specifies a scheduled task used to back up a selection of resources.

SelectionName.documentation: The display name of a resource selection document.

IamRoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that AWS Backup uses to authenticate when restoring the target resource; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

Resources.documentation: An array of strings that either contain Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) or match patterns such as "arn:aws:ec2:us-east-1:123456789012:volume/*" of resources to assign to a backup plan.

ListOfTags.documentation: An array of conditions used to specify a set of resources to assign to a backup plan; for example, "StringEquals": {"ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting".

BackupSelection.documentation: Used to specify a set of resources to a backup plan.

SelectionId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

SelectionName.documentation: The display name of a resource selection document.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a resource backup is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

NumberOfRecoveryPoints.documentation: The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.

MoveToColdStorageAt.documentation: A timestamp that specifies when to transition a recovery point to cold storage.

DeleteAt.documentation: A timestamp that specifies when to delete a recovery point.

CalculatedLifecycle.documentation:
Contains DeleteAt and MoveToColdStorageAt timestamps, which are used to specify a lifecycle for a recovery point.

The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

ConditionType.documentation: An operation, such as StringEquals, that is applied to a key-value pair used to filter resources in a selection.

ConditionKey.documentation: The key in a key-value pair. For example, in "ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting", "ec2:ResourceTag/Department" is the key.

ConditionValue.documentation: The value in a key-value pair. For example, in "ec2:ResourceTag/Department": "accounting", "accounting" is the value.

Condition.documentation: Contains an array of triplets made up of a condition type (such as StringEquals), a key, and a value. Conditions are used to filter resources in a selection that is assigned to a backup plan.

BackupPlan.documentation: Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a BackupPlanName and one or more sets of Rules.

BackupPlanTags.documentation: To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair. The specified tags are assigned to all backups created with this plan.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: Identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice. If the request includes a CreatorRequestId that matches an existing backup plan, that plan is returned. This parameter is optional.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1024 bytes long. They cannot be edited.

BackupPlanId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the backup plan to be associated with the selection of resources.

BackupSelection.documentation:
Specifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

It includes an array of resources, an optional array of patterns to exclude resources, an optional role to provide access to the AWS service the resource belongs to, and an optional array of tags used to identify a set of resources.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

SelectionId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a backup selection is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultTags.documentation: Metadata that you can assign to help organize the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a backup vault is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50.

DeletionDate.documentation: The date and time a backup plan is deleted, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version Ids cannot be edited.

SelectionId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and theAWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

DependencyFailureException.documentation: A dependent AWS service or resource returned an error to the AWS Backup service, and the action cannot be completed.

BackupJobId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a request to AWS Backup to back up a resource.
Uniquely identifies a request to AWS Backup to back up a resource.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a backup job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date and time that a job to create a backup job is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

State.documentation: The current state of a resource recovery point.

StatusMessage.documentation: A detailed message explaining the status of the job to back up a resource.

PercentDone.documentation: Contains an estimated percentage that is complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.

BackupSizeInBytes.documentation: The size, in bytes, of a backup.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

CreatedBy.documentation: Contains identifying information about the creation of a backup job, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan that is used to create it.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of AWS resource to be backed-up; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

BytesTransferred.documentation: The size in bytes transferred to a backup vault at the time that the job status was queried.

ExpectedCompletionDate.documentation: The date and time that a job to back up resources is expected to be completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of ExpectedCompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

StartBy.documentation: Specifies the time in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when a backup job must be started before it is canceled. The value is calculated by adding the start window to the scheduled time. So if the scheduled time were 6:00 PM and the start window is 2 hours, the StartBy time would be 8:00 PM on the date specified. The value of StartBy is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The server-side encryption key that is used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a backup vault is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

NumberOfRecoveryPoints.documentation: The number of recovery points that are stored in a backup vault.

ResourceArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of AWS resource saved as a recovery point; for example, an EBS volume or an Amazon RDS database.

LastBackupTime.documentation: The date and time that a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastBackupTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.
An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a saved resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of AWS resource to save as a recovery point; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

CreatedBy.documentation: Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery point, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan used to create it.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

Status.documentation:
A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.

A partial status indicates that the recovery point was not successfully re-created and must be retried.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a recovery point is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date and time that a job to create a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

BackupSizeInBytes.documentation: The size, in bytes, of a backup.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups that are transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

EncryptionKeyArn.documentation: The server-side encryption key used to protect your backups; for example, arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

IsEncrypted.documentation: A Boolean value that is returned as TRUE if the specified recovery point is encrypted, or FALSE if the recovery point is not encrypted.

StorageClass.documentation: Specifies the storage class of the recovery point. Valid values are WARM or COLD.

LastRestoreTime.documentation: The date and time that a recovery point was last restored, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastRestoreTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

RestoreJobId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.
Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a restore job is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date and time that a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

Status.documentation: Status code specifying the state of the job that is initiated by AWS Backup to restore a recovery point.

StatusMessage.documentation: A detailed message explaining the status of a job to restore a recovery point.

PercentDone.documentation: Contains an estimated percentage that is complete of a job at the time the job status was queried.

BackupSizeInBytes.documentation: The size, in bytes, of the restored resource.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

ExpectedCompletionTimeMinutes.documentation: The amount of time in minutes that a job restoring a recovery point is expected to take.

CreatedResourceArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource whose recovery point is being restored. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type of the backed-up resource.

BackupPlanTemplateJson.documentation:
The body of a backup plan template in JSON format.

This is a signed JSON document that cannot be modified before being passed to GetBackupPlanFromJSON.
A customer-supplied backup plan document in JSON format.

BackupPlan.documentation: Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a BackupPlanName and one or more sets of Rules.

BackupPlanTemplateId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a stored backup plan template.

BackupPlanDocument.documentation: Returns the body of a backup plan based on the target template, including the name, rules, and backup vault of the plan.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.

BackupPlan.documentation: Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a BackupPlanName and one or more sets of Rules.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version IDs cannot be edited.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a backup plan is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

DeletionDate.documentation: The date and time that a backup plan is deleted, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

LastExecutionDate.documentation: The last time a job to back up resources was executed with this backup plan. A date and time, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastExecutionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

SelectionId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

BackupSelection.documentation:
Specifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

It includes an array of resources, an optional array of patterns to exclude resources, an optional role to provide access to the AWS service that the resource belongs to, and an optional array of tags used to identify a set of resources.

SelectionId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the body of a request to assign a set of resources to a backup plan.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a backup selection is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CreatorRequestId.documentation: A unique string that identifies the request and allows failed requests to be retried without the risk of executing the operation twice.

RestoreMetadata.documentation: A set of metadata key-value pairs that lists the metadata key-value pairs that are required to restore the recovery point.

ResourceTypes.documentation:
Contains a string with the supported AWS resource types:

  • EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store

  • SGW for AWS Storage Gateway

  • RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service

  • DDB for Amazon DynamoDB

  • EFS for Amazon Elastic File System

InvalidParameterValueException.documentation: Indicates that something is wrong with a parameter's value. For example, the value is out of range.

InvalidRequestException.documentation: Indicates that something is wrong with the input to the request. For example, a parameter is of the wrong type.

MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is moved to cold storage.

DeleteAfterDays.documentation: Specifies the number of days after creation that a recovery point is deleted. Must be greater than MoveToColdStorageAfterDays.

Lifecycle.documentation: Contains an array of Transition objects specifying how long in days before a recovery point transitions to cold storage or is deleted.

LimitExceededException.documentation: A limit in the request has been exceeded; for example, a maximum number of items allowed in a request.

NextToken.documentation: The next item following a partial list of returned items. For example, if a request is made to return maxResults number of items, NextToken allows you to return more items in your list starting at the location pointed to by the next token.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of items to be returned.

ByResourceArn.documentation: Returns only backup jobs that match the specified resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

ByState.documentation: Returns only backup jobs that are in the specified state.

ByBackupVaultName.documentation: Returns only backup jobs that will be stored in the specified backup vault. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

ByCreatedBefore.documentation: Returns only backup jobs that were created before the specified date.

ByCreatedAfter.documentation: Returns only backup jobs that were created after the specified date.

ByResourceType.documentation:
Returns only backup jobs for the specified resources:

  • EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store

  • SGW for AWS Storage Gateway

  • RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service

  • DDB for Amazon DynamoDB

  • EFS for Amazon Elastic File System

Tags.documentation: To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

MissingParameterValueException.documentation: Indicates that a required parameter is missing.

ResourceArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of AWS resource; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

LastBackupTime.documentation: The date and time a resource was last backed up, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of LastBackupTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

ProtectedResource.documentation: A structure that contains information about a backed-up resource.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

Policy.documentation: The backup vault access policy document in JSON format.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

SNSTopicArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that specifies the topic for a backup vault’s events; for example, arn:aws:sns:us-west-2:111122223333:MyVaultTopic.

BackupVaultEvents.documentation: An array of events that indicate the status of jobs to back up resources to the backup vault.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

ResourceType.documentation: The type of AWS resource saved as a recovery point; for example, an Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume or an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) database.

CreatedBy.documentation: Contains identifying information about the creation of a recovery point, including the BackupPlanArn, BackupPlanId, BackupPlanVersion, and BackupRuleId of the backup plan that is used to create it.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

Status.documentation: A status code specifying the state of the recovery point.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a recovery point is created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

CompletionDate.documentation: The date and time a job to restore a recovery point is completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

BackupSizeInBytes.documentation: The size, in bytes, of a backup.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

ResourceArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the resource type.

IamRoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role ARN used to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A customer chosen string that can be used to distinguish between calls to StartBackupJob. Idempotency tokens time out after one hour. Therefore, if you call StartBackupJob multiple times with the same idempotency token within one hour, AWS Backup recognizes that you are requesting only one backup job and initiates only one. If you change the idempotency token for each call, AWS Backup recognizes that you are requesting to start multiple backups.

StartWindowMinutes.documentation: The amount of time in minutes before beginning a backup.

CompleteWindowMinutes.documentation: The amount of time AWS Backup attempts a backup before canceling the job and returning an error.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup will transition and expire backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

RecoveryPointTags.documentation: To help organize your resources, you can assign your own metadata to the resources that you create. Each tag is a key-value pair.

BackupJobId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a request to AWS Backup to back up a resource.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time that a backup job is started, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

Metadata.documentation: A set of metadata key-value pairs. Lists the metadata that the recovery point was created with.

IamRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that AWS Backup uses to create the target recovery point; for example, arn:aws:iam::123456789012:role/S3Access.

IdempotencyToken.documentation: A customer chosen string that can be used to distinguish between calls to StartRestoreJob. Idempotency tokens time out after one hour. Therefore, if you call StartRestoreJob multiple times with the same idempotency token within one hour, AWS Backup recognizes that you are requesting only one restore job and initiates only one. If you change the idempotency token for each call, AWS Backup recognizes that you are requesting to start multiple restores.

ResourceType.documentation:
Starts a job to restore a recovery point for one of the following resources:

  • EBS for Amazon Elastic Block Store

  • SGW for AWS Storage Gateway

  • RDS for Amazon Relational Database Service

  • DDB for Amazon DynamoDB

  • EFS for Amazon Elastic File System

RestoreJobId.documentation: Uniquely identifies the job that restores a recovery point.

BackupJobId.documentation: Uniquely identifies a request to AWS Backup to back up a resource.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the type of the tagged resource.

Tags.documentation: Key-value pairs that are used to help organize your resources. You can assign your own metadata to the resources you create.

ResourceArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a resource. The format of the ARN depends on the type of the tagged resource.

TagKeyList.documentation: A list of keys to identify which key-value tags to remove from a resource.

BackupPlan.documentation: Specifies the body of a backup plan. Includes a BackupPlanName and one or more sets of Rules.

BackupPlanArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a backup plan; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:plan:8F81F553-3A74-4A3F-B93D-B3360DC80C50.

CreationDate.documentation: The date and time a backup plan is updated, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationDate is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

VersionId.documentation: Unique, randomly generated, Unicode, UTF-8 encoded strings that are at most 1,024 bytes long. Version Ids cannot be edited.

BackupVaultName.documentation: The name of a logical container where backups are stored. Backup vaults are identified by names that are unique to the account used to create them and the AWS Region where they are created. They consist of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

BackupVaultArn.documentation: An ARN that uniquely identifies a backup vault; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:vault:aBackupVault.

RecoveryPointArn.documentation: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies a recovery point; for example, arn:aws:backup:us-east-1:123456789012:recovery-point:1EB3B5E7-9EB0-435A-A80B-108B488B0D45.

Lifecycle.documentation:
The lifecycle defines when a protected resource is transitioned to cold storage and when it expires. AWS Backup transitions and expires backups automatically according to the lifecycle that you define.

Backups transitioned to cold storage must be stored in cold storage for a minimum of 90 days. Therefore, the “expire after days” setting must be 90 days greater than the “transition to cold after days” setting. The “transition to cold after days” setting cannot be changed after a backup has been transitioned to cold.

documentation:
AWS Backup

AWS Backup is a unified backup service designed to protect AWS services and their associated data. AWS Backup simplifies the creation, migration, restoration, and deletion of backups, while also providing reporting and auditing.
